title: Wilson's Tales of the Borders and of Scotland, Volume 02
author: Alexander Leighton
snippet: "I was acquainted with old William Burns," said my companion, "when hewas gardener at Denholm, an' got intimate wi' his son Robert when helived wi' us at Irvine, a twalmonth syne.

title: Tales and sketches.
author: Miller, Hugh
snippet: " I was acquainted with old William Burns," said my companion, " when he was gardener at Denholm, an' got intimate wi' his son Robert when he lived wi' us at Irvine a twalmonth syne.

title: The captain of the guard.
author: Grant, James
snippet: On the earl's train disappearing among the wooded hollows which lay between the city and the furzy slope of Braid and Liberton, the captain of the guard and his kinsman the lieutenant, with their esquires, pages, and lacqueys passed forth from the castle, to swell the retinue of the chief magistrate of the city, Sir Thomas Cranston of that ilk, baron of Denholm and Stobs, warden of the marches, and one of the conservators of peace upon the borders, for the steel-gloved provosts of those stirring times were men of a different metal from the men of words, who " twaddle " in the same place in this age of steam and electricity.

title: Miscellaneous Prose Works of Sir Walter Scott, Bart
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: Cavers and Denholm, the scenes of his childhood, and Harden, formerly the seat of an ancient family from which oneof his friends is descended, detain him with particular fondness.

title: Miscellaneous Prose Works of Sir Walter Scott, Bart
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: In a wild recess,in the den or glen which gives name to the villageof Denholm, he contrived a sort of furnace for thepurpose of such chemical experiments as he wasadequate to performing.

title: Miscellaneous Prose Works of Sir Walter Scott, Bart
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: This precious bookwas in possession of a blacksmith's apprentice, wholived at several miles' distance from Denholm, andthe season was winter.

title: Miscellaneous Prose Works of Sir Walter Scott, Bart
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: Mr. Duncan, aCameronian minister at Denholm,1 became nowhis instructor in the Latin language.

title: Miscellaneous Prose Works of Sir Walter Scott, Bart
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: " About a year aster his birth," says his relative and biographer, Mr. Morton, " hisjparents removed to Henlawshiel, alonely cottage, about three miles from Denholm, on the farmof Nether Tofts, which was then held by Mr. Andrew Blythe,bis mother's uncle.

title: Miscellaneous Prose Works of Sir Walter Scott, Bart
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: John Leyden, so eminent for the genius whichhe displayed, and the extensive knowledge wliichhe accumulated during his brief career, was bornat Denholm, on the 8th September, 1775, and bredup, like other children in the same humble line oflife, to such country labour as suited his strength.

title: Miscellaneous Prose Works of Sir Walter Scott, Bart
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: John Leyden, residing in the village of Denholm,and parish of Cavers, Roxburghshire, and IsabellaScott, his wife, were the parents of Dr. Leyden,and still survive to deplore the irreparable loss ofa son, the honour alike of his family and country.
